benchmark_details.name: Alignment Data Map
benchmark_details.overview: The Alignment Data Map is a GPT-4o-assisted tool for analyzing and diagnosing preference data used in aligning large language models with human values, focusing on collecting high-quality samples efficiently and diagnosing existing preference datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the efficiency of data collection for aligning large language models and to identify mis-annotated samples in existing preference datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The method relies on similarity calculations which may introduce length biases and uses LLM-based evaluations which could have biases.

data.source: UltraFeedback dataset constructed from multiple preference instructions evaluated with LLMs.
data.annotation: Initially generated by multiple LLMs, with feedback evaluated by GPT-4o.

metrics: Alignment scores based on mean and variance
methodology.calculation: Alignment scores computed using similarity from responses to a proxy response generated by GPT-4o.
methodology.interpretation: Higher alignment scores indicate better adherence to human preferences.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance compared using full dataset, random subsets, and established benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against standard alignment benchmarks like MT-Bench and Evol-Instruct.
